issue.title: [question/documentation/roadmap] macOS OpenGL deprecation: documents on switching backends

repository.name: Makie.jl
repository.description: Interactive data visualizations and plotting in Julia

issue.body:
For macos, OpenGL is scheduled to be deprecated (see, e.g. [here](https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2018/06/the-end-of-opengl-support-other-updates-apple-didnt-share-at-the-keynote/)). Looks like there's currently work on

https://github.com/JuliaPlots/GRMakie.jl
https://github.com/JuliaPlots/CairoMakie.jl

but documentation for these seems to be missing, e.g. 

```
using CairoMakie, AbstractPlotting
x = LinRange(0,3pi,200)
y = sin.(x)
c=lines(x,y)
```
does not return anything, `typeof(c)` gives `Scene`, and `display(AbstractPlotting.PlotDisplay(),c)` gives

> (CairoMakie.CairoBackend(SVG::RenderType = 0, "/var/folders/d8/hcnrglbn5ts52xx1hp_wx4480000gn/T/tmpcOPoFU/cairo.svg"), Scene(nothing, Events(Observable{GeometryTypes.HyperRectangle{2,Int64}} with 1 listeners. Value:
> GeometryTypes.HyperRectangle{2,Int64}([0, 0], [0, 0]), Observable{Float64} with 0 listeners. Value:
> 100.0, Observable{Bool} with 0 listeners. Value:
> ......(long text output)

looks like the plot is saved to a temporary svg file `cairo.svg` but no gui is displayed.

issue.title: Fixes for Big Sur and M1
issue.body:
Some tasks need to be taken care of:

- [x] (Big Sur) Remove image_base to fix luajit linking issue
- [x] (M1) Fix broken [glfw create window](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1809)

issue.title: Mac/Apple Silicon: Fix crash-on-launch by using modern API to get display name

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
On Apple Silicon, IOKit is deprecated and there will be no
matching io_service that we can query for name. Luckilly,
NSScreen got an API to fetch the display name in 10.15.

This is a blocker to get glfw running on Apple Silicon.
Fixes https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1809
